Draw plausible values from an mml fit

Source: R/drawPVs.sdf.R
drawPVs.sdf.Rd

Draw plausible values from an mml fit

# S3 method for sdf
drawPVs(
  data,
  mml,
  npv = 5L,
  stochasticBeta = FALSE,
  normalApprox = TRUE,
  newStuDat = NULL,
  newStuItems = NULL,
  returnPosterior = FALSE,
  construct = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

data

an edsurvey.data.frame or light.edsurvey.data.frame to which the plausible values will be added.

mml

a fit from a call to mml.sdf, or a summary.mml.sdf, which is a summary of mml.sdf call.

npv

integer indicating the number of plausible values to draw

stochasticBeta

logical when TRUE the regressopm coefficients will be drawn from their posterior distribution. Can also be a data frame of values (see Details).

normalApprox

logical; use the normal approximation to draw PVs

newStuDat

new student-level covariate data

newStuItems

new student item data

returnPosterior

logical set to TRUE to change output to include two additional data frames (see Value).

construct

the construct to draw PVs for

...

additional parameters
